timeline.message: Add parser node transformer support for object-constructor-expression

timeline.bodyText: 🏕️  Not related to this PR

timeline.message: Add init method checks for object-ctor-expression
Remove balos as cannot disable on old parser

timeline.bodyText: these context starts  and closes are not necessary.
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText: Since we come here after checking next token is CLIENT_KEYWORD, we can directly use consume() without going to parseClientKeyword()
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText:
we need type-reference := identifier | qualified-identifier right? not a typeDescriptor
can use parseQualifiedIdentifier() for that.
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: Please help check changed according to this and comment #25302 (comment)

replies.bodyText: Current way of parsing looks OK to me!
replies.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText: Shall we change method name parseObjectConstructorExpressionNode to parseObjectConstructorExpression to be aligned with other expressions.
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText: don't need this context as well since we are already inside OBJECT_CONSTRUCTOR context
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

timeline.bodyText:
I think currently parseObjectMembers() allows object-type-inclusion := * type-reference ; as well.
I can fix this when adding error recovery though. :)
timeline.author: lochana-chathura

replies.author: KRVPerera

replies.bodyText:
Class level variables can be dangerous since the parser is recursive-descent.
eg: an anon-object inside the object constructor - then the flag is set to true when the parser reaches the inner construct, where it should have been false
Passing a flag to the method as a parameter would be fine though.
replies.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: If we invert the conditions of if-else stmts, we can reduce the number of nested levels.
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Ideally we shouldn't reach here. So throwing an exception would be better.
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Better to use the complete name BLangObjectConstructorExpression, since this is part of the public API.
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: extra newline
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Let's complete these parameters
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText:
Here there are three possible paths:

client keyword --> parse the qualifiers
object keyword --> parse object
non of the above --> recover and re-parse

Thus, to handle these three cases we need a switch-case here. Refer parseFunctionBody() for a similar method.
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Same as my prev comment in L#4399
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Shall we remove these additional newlines?
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.message: Fix first code review suggestion by parser team
Change testng class to package level in xml

Fix Parser suggestions for object-constructor-expr

Joined object-constructor-body to object-constructor-expression
Use existing object-type-qualifiers to parse client token
Changed type definition to correct type-reference

timeline.bodyText: Shall we use parseTypeReference() here rather than directly using parseQualifiedIdentifier()?
timeline.author: rdulmina

timeline.message: Disallow type inclusion inside object constructor
Fix coding style of object ctor negative tests
Update class changes parseObjectMember api call
Update class changes parseObjectMember api call

Clean code for object-constructor-expression body

Reduce if statement nested levels. Throw an exception for object-type
inclusion. This is already handled at parser level.
Add error for type inclusion in object-ctor body
